column4: Democrats‚Äô attempted delay antics over the last seven-plus days were absurd. After they voted to block COVID relief multiple times & tried to adjourn the Senate entirely, Dems suddenly brought up a completely unrealistic ‚Äúrelief‚Äù bill to delay the #SCOTUS vote. Pure theatrics. https://t.co/jH2PBJ1jOb

Hard to believe that Senate Democrats just voted AGAIN to block COVID relief. There are Americans who can't feed their families because of the economic side effects of COVID-19 shutdowns, yet Democrats still refuse to act unless GOP allows 2.4 trillion in irresponsible spending.

Why haven't we passed more COVID relief? Let‚Äôs boil this down, because it‚Äôs pretty simple. Dems are sabotaging negotiations & holding relief hostage over blue-state bailouts. Pelosi's all-or-nothing negotiating tactics can't work, & sadly, it‚Äôs Americans who'll pay the price. https://t.co/0gwARcWtBE

Republicans have tried for months to pass targeted support for Americans affected by COVID. We've proposed multiple relief bills, but Pelosi's demand is hundreds of billions for blue state bailouts or no deal. How can we find common ground when this is how she negotiates? https://t.co/4OfzPBnX8n

Had a great discussion at @USD‚Äôs panel on the business implications of COVID-19 & the challenges/opportunities it could present for South Dakota. Thanks to @USDPresident Gestring & Biz School Dean @Venky4 for inviting me to speak & meet some of their impressive students. https://t.co/iECt0PINsI

Watching today's hearing, you would‚Äôve thought it was a floor debate on health care. Dems know they can‚Äôt fault Judge Barrett on her merits, so they‚Äôre relying on scare tactics. The truth is, we have no idea how¬†she¬†will rule on any case. But we do know she'll follow the law.

Nancy Pelosi is holding key COVID aid hostage unless Congress adds trillions more to the national debt.¬†

Targeted COVID relief?¬†
‚ÄúNo.‚Äù ‚ùå
Lifeline for small businesses?¬†
‚ÄúNo.‚Äù ‚ùå
Airline employee assistance?¬†
‚ÄúNo.‚Äù ‚ùå

It‚Äôs pretty clear she‚Äôs putting politics above policy.
Praying for the continued health of our president and first lady after their #COVID19 diagnosis and for all Americans who have been affected by this awful virus. We‚Äôre still in this fight together.

When Republicans saw Dems had left key ag funding out of the CR, we demanded it be fixed. It's been a hard year for farmers/ranchers: low commodity prices, bad weather, difficulties w/ markets, and ‚Äì of course ‚Äì #COVID. Very glad we were able to get this funding back in the bill. https://t.co/R7BOjrrvyR

During New York‚Äôs toughest moments of #COVID19, medical professionals from around the country stepped in to help. Instead of gratitude, Gov. Cuomo demanded these workers pay NY's (famously high) income tax while there. https://t.co/JoBiuv1fRE

Very mature. America is battling a global pandemic and mourning the loss of a Supreme Court justice, but Chuck Schumer is determined to prevent committees from meeting on important topics like election security. #TemperTantrum https://t.co/JlAiPnYqvo

Speaker Pelosi has withheld vital CCC funding from the House govt funding bill ‚Äì reneging on the previous bipartisan agreement. This $ would go toward helping American farmers hit hard by the pandemic, feeding children who normally rely on school lunches, & other vital areas.

I couldn‚Äôt agree more.¬†@DepSecSteve¬†is an old friend and colleague of mine and one of the best advocates for the American ag community. We spoke just this morning about providing additional relief funding to farmers & ranchers impacted by¬†#COVID19. I thank him for his service. https://t.co/JmzOce4UIy

Good to see this admin supporting American farmers & ranchers. The @USDA announced second round of vital #CFAP $ to help producers hit hard by #COVID19. At the beginning of #COVID19, there was concern over food shortages. We have our f&r to thank for these fears not coming true. https://t.co/yTXi8I7qZa

Senate Dems recently filibustered:
‚ùå Relief funding for schools
‚ùå COVID vaccine funding
‚ùå Stimulus payments to Americans
‚ùå Police reform
Now, they‚Äôre saying they would eliminate the filibuster.

This situation stretches the meaning of irony ‚Äì even by Washington standards.

I hope every American understands what's been happening in Congress w/ #COVID relief funding. Republicans have been trying in earnest to pass a bill; we've offered multiple versions & pursued negotiations. Dems intro‚Äôd one spending spree bill & adamantly refused to compromise.
RT @USATODAY: Senate Democrats blocked a $300 billion coronavirus stimulus bill Thursday in one of the last attempts before the November el‚Ä¶

Let‚Äôs be clear: The Democrats‚Äô current negotiating position is that unless Congress passes their $3 trillion #COVID spending proposal, they aren't interested in a deal. That's right, Dems think providing Americans with *zero* assistance is better than our targeted bill. https://t.co/C9vC3ViRqL

Here‚Äôs a quick update on our latest effort to get vital funding to Americans who are most impacted by the #coronavirus pandemic üëáüèª

We‚Äôre focused on areas with the most immediate need:
- unemployed Americans
- vaccine research
- small businesses
- testing
- students & parents https://t.co/uK68P7IBud

.@SenateGOP‚Äôs latest #coronavirus relief bill is another effort by Republicans to try to find common ground on a realistic #COVID19 funding proposal. This week's vote will be an opportunity for Dems to finally take action after showing an unwillingness to negotiate for months.

There have been two consistent themes of the #COVID19 federal response:
1. Dems‚Äô unwillingness to negotiate on any point unless GOP agrees to add trillions to the national debt.
2. Republicans‚Äô efforts to find common ground on a targeted and fiscally responsible COVID relief.

Hanging out with Haven. This may be one of the rare summers I don‚Äôt mind seeing come to an end, but this COVID grand baby has been a 2020 bright spot. #blessed #LaborDayWeekend https://t.co/qFgqoTz9Bs

1.4 million jobs were added back, and unemployment fell lower in August ‚Äì a pretty good #JobsReport showing improvement in the economy. We still have a ways to go to get back to the stellar economy we had before #COVID19, but this a good progress. https://t.co/s9oSU7pSkN

Any #AV policy must ensure 3 things:
1. preserve roles of federal & state regulators
2. build on @NHTSAgov‚Äôs efforts to update regulations not written with AVs in mind
3. enhance NHTSA‚Äôs ability to expand testing & grant exemptions if existing regulations block safety innovations

Thank you to the fantastic folks at Prairie Lakes Healthcare System for taking the time to show me around their facility and update me on the work they are doing to help keep their community healthy. These men and women have been on the frontline of the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/Z8rSXyaBv2

It felt great to be back meeting with South Dakotans in person. Thank you to the folks at Avera Queen of Peace Hospital for providing an update on their response to #COVID19. Our health care providers have been the heroes throughout this pandemic. https://t.co/e9J3VHKC2O

The July #JobsReport was better than predicted with 1.8 million jobs added + a lower unemployment rate. After the economy took a big hit during the shutdown, we are continuing to work our way back to what was a stellar economy pre-#COVID19. https://t.co/UbO7yYn1XP

Republicans want to pass a coronavirus relief bill, & we‚Äôre ready to negotiate. But Democrats have to want to come to the table. ‚ÄòOur way or the highway‚Äô is not a negotiating position. I hope ‚Äì I really hope ‚Äì that Dems will work with us on a bill that can actually become law.

Republicans have offered multiple proposals for the next step of #COVID19 relief, yet each time Democrats come back with the same response: "pass the HEROES Act.‚Äù
1. This bill won't pass ‚Äì it‚Äôs not targeted & not fiscally responsible
2. This is not how negotiations work.

When Republicans announced our #COVID19 relief bill, we knew our version wouldn‚Äôt be the final draft & were open to negotiating. But negotiations involve compromise on both sides, and Democrats apparently aren‚Äôt willing to budge one inch on their $3 trillion+, 100% partisan bill. https://t.co/V1GmjZqJCf

Let‚Äôs be clear, Dems‚Äô $3 trillion+ #COVID bill will never pass the Senate. It‚Äôs not targeted. It‚Äôs not fiscally responsible. Republicans have been trying to negotiate in good faith, but Dems refuse to work w/ us to find common ground, & they continue to push their messaging bill.

There‚Äôs only one way we‚Äôre going to make progress on the next round of COVID relief: Democrats must come to the table in a serious way. @SenateGOP wants to help, but piling an additional $3 TRILLION onto the national debt, as Dems have suggested, is a totally unserious proposal.
RT @senatemajldr: The coronavirus does not care that we are divided. The coronavirus will not care if Washington Democrats decide it suits‚Ä¶

Coronavirus has turned lives upside down. People who are now working remotely in a different state than their office and medical professionals who traveled to help fight #COVID19 should NOT be subject to higher & more complicated tax bills. My proposal üëáüèª https://t.co/ymA5XcgUXW

SCAM WARNING: If the @SDDOH contacts you about potential #COVID19 exposure, they will NEVER ask for credit card info or money. If you are asked for this info or asked to pay anything, it is a scam. It's sad to see scammers taking advantage of this crisis. 
https://t.co/S2CVEE9DJ6

If Dems want to play a productive role in the next phase of COVID relief, we have a good place to start w/ our targeted HEALS Act. The House bill, which would cost $3 TRILLION+, is chock-full of liberal agenda items, fiscally irresponsible, & will not be considered in the Senate. https://t.co/tbnn4ky357

The #HEALSAct announced by @senatemajldr is the result of months of careful evaluation of existing #COVID19 relief efforts. This new, targeted relief bill will give support to Americans who truly need it. I‚Äôm hopeful we can come to an agreement that reflects these priorities.

The HEALS Act would provide targeted and effective relief to the people who need it the most: health care heroes on the front lines of this pandemic, Americans struggling through the resulting economic crisis, small biz owners who are trying to sustain/rebuild, and our students.

Without a doubt, we cannot reverse this economic downturn w/o attacking the underlying health care crisis. We must ensure medical workers have resources to treat patients, develop treatments, & find a vaccine. This continues to be a priority in the next phase of #COVID relief.

I hope that my Senate Democrat colleagues will eventually look beyond their liberal wish list & work with us to build a bipartisan #COVID19 relief package that addresses the real issues Americans are facing. This bill is not an opportunity to sneak through partisan agenda items. https://t.co/D7PHIvFhit

Experts in childhood health, like @AmerAcadPeds, have advocated for policies that prioritize getting our kids back to school *safely*. This shouldn‚Äôt be a politized issue. Attending school in person is so important for our children's academic development & emotional wellbeing.

RT @dailyrepublic: Local experts, medical professionals agree: Mask up
https://t.co/ocnLq1yie9 https://t.co/cerq5Oo5jq

We‚Äôve been closely monitoring the $2.4 trillion in relief funds that have already been allocated to fight #COVID. We‚Äôve held dozens of coronavirus hearings to identify how we can provide targeted & fiscally responsible relief. 

Focus of the next phase: kids, jobs, & health care.

A few of my priorities in this next phase of federal #COVID relief:
-More relief for struggling Americans
-Funding for impacted farmers & ranchers
-Protection from surprise state taxes for #COVID relief & mobile/remote workers
-Telehealth
-Liability protections for schools & biz

We had a good meeting with @senategop & members of the president‚Äôs team where we discussed some of the broad principles of the next round of federal #COVID19 relief for the American people. We are all in agreement that this effort is about kids, jobs, and health care.

The #COVID19 crisis we‚Äôre facing today is different than the one we saw in March, & as a result, so will be our response. Waiting and evaluating was the right call.
While Rs and Ds might have differing priorities for this next phase, there is a common-sense solution within reach. https://t.co/TlTQzlrbBr

To protect against #COVID19, our hospitals, biz, schools, & consumers need dependable access to hand sanitizer. I intro'd a bill to help grant certainty to ethanol, distillers, & other industries that are stepping up to produce hand sanitizer. https://t.co/YpSmHoamdi

Consumers believe in America. They know that our country will come back stronger than ever after #COVID19. Step one for a sustainable recovery needs to be keeping people safe. Remember to wear a mask so we don‚Äôt lose ground in this fight. https://t.co/FrUKcqsjni

We brought the Senate back to Washington to look at serious items and spent the last two weeks at work: hearing from experts on #COVID19, passing critical national security legislation, & monitoring the effectiveness of relief efforts already being implemented.
